717279f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Bleecker Street
717279f-a.text:
Broadway, north from Bleecker Street, showing prominently
the Broadway Central Hotel on the west side of this thor-
oughfare, alightly to the south of West 3rd Street. In
the distant background, at the point where this arterial
causeway bends, is the shadowy outline of Grace Church.
About 1895
Gift of Urbrock Collection

724419f-a.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Bleecker Street
724419f-a.text:
West Broadway, east side, north from but not including Bleecker
Street, to and including Washington Square, North.
About 1905.
Brown Brothers.
724419f-a.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

717277f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Bleecker Street
717277f.text:
N635-637 Broadway,West Side.,between Bleecker and
WTest Houston Streots.
Hovember 7,th,1913.
Wurts Brothers,Photographers,
No Reproductions.

716688f-a.title: Manhattan: Bleecker Street - West Broadway.
716688f-a.text:
144-6 Bleecker Street, adjoining the S.W. corner
of West Broadway showing Mori's Restaurant, founded in
1884 by Placido Mori. These buildings were remodelled
by Raymond Hood who Ioslded on Nashington Square North,
above the restaurant proprietors. This photo was reprgduced
on page 88 of the published volume "Changing New York."
November 21, 1935
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
716688f-a.folder: Bleecker Street & West Broadway., Manhattan, NY

724417f.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Bleecker Street
724417f.text:
West Broadway, north from Bleecker Street, showing a track removal
project under way. Overhead is the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.
December 7, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
724417f.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

717278f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - [Bleecker Street]
717278f-a.text:
P.L. Sperr collection
Rec'd January 13, 1945
Niee Ne SOS5

724416f-b.title: Manhattan: West Broadway - Bleecker Street
724416f-b.text:
West Broadway, north from the Bleecker Street platform of
the Sixth Avenue Elevated line,to Washington Square. On the
horizon, beyond that point appears the Metropolitan, New York
Life and Chrysler Buildings. Note the westward bend on N. 3rd
Street of this transportation line. Civic authorities at this
time have filed notice of demolition for the complete Sixth
Avenue Elevated line and same will shortly disapnear from the
Manhattan scene; its services being performed by the about to
be completed Sixth Avenue Municipal Subway.
May 23, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
'. L. Sperr
The same thoroughfare subsequent to tho 'pT1' demolition.
Note the distinctive apartment house, No. 1 Fifth Avenue, in
the background. Washington Square intervenes between this
point and the end of this street.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724416f-b.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY
